Fireskrit, it's not always that easy - I live in a country where we have DATA LIMITS - Not only do they count the downloads towards that, they count the UPLOADS. Exceed your limit and that's it - 64k for the rest of the month.
A big torrent like this really eats into your 50GB limit.
That being said, I always try to leave things up until I'm at least at 1:1 - even if I have to stop it and put it up again next month. Maybe I should make that 2:1

Quality is OK and definitely in English - I just watched the first 10 Episodes.
I've watched most of it with subtitles, but this is definitely easier to concentrate on. Does lose some of the Japanese feel, though. The story is always changed slightly for us westerners.

@Anmaddox Do you seriously think that PEERBLOCK is going to help mask your Download/Upload usage from your ISP (Internet Service Provider)? I am in awe that you could call him stupid and provide such a ridiculous statement after .

NO program on your computer can hide your download/upload usage. You are connecting to your ISP and everything you download or upload is going through them. There is no way around a ISP Download/Upload limit because your ISP keeps track of EVERYTHING that happens on your connection.

Video quality is all around good and the best I've seen online for Eng Dubbed Bleach. Video resolution/quality is different for each season and ranges from 480p to 720p (Season 9 being 720p and the best quality from what I've seen).

The quality of the video/audio overall is great for the size of this torrent. I suggest anyone who wants to watch Bleach in English download this torrent.

BTW, Don't listen to some of the idiots above, this torrent is basically flawless. All episode are the correct length and I have experienced no episodes cutting off or "half working".
